intro: Plectronia vulgaris, commonly known as the common plectronia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white or pale green, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Plectronia vulgaris is often found in meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
